1.t: Alif. Lam. Ra. These are the verses of the Book and the glorious Quran.
1.tr: Alif-Laaam-Raa; tilka Aayaatul Kitaabi Wa-Qur-aa-nim Mubeen

2.t: How strongly the unbelievers will wish that they had been Muslims.
2.tr: Rubamaa yawaddul lazeena kafaroo law kaanoo muslimeen

3.t: (Muhammad), leave them alone to eat and enjoy themselves and let their desires deceive them; they will soon know (the Truth).
3.tr: Zarhum yaakuloo Wa-yatamatta'oo Wa-yulhihimul amalu fasawfa ya'lamoon

4.t: We never destroyed any town without pre-ordaining the fate of its people.
4.tr: Wa-maaa ahlaknaa min qaryatin illaa Wa-lahaa kitaabum ma'loom

5.t: Every nation can only live for the time appointed for it.
5.tr: Maa tasbiqu min ummatin ajalahaa Wa-maa yastaakhiroon

6.t: (The unbelievers have said), "You to whom the Quran has been revealed are insane.
6.tr: Wa-qaaloo yaaa-aiyuhal lazee nuzzila 'alaihiz Zikru innaka lamajnoon

7.t: Why do you not bring down the angels if what you say is true".
7.tr: Law maa taateenaa bil-malaaa'ikati in kunta minas saadiqeen

8.t: We do not send down angels except for a genuine purpose, at which time none will be given any further respite.
8.tr: Maa nunazzilul malaaa'i-kata illaa bilhaqqi Wa-maa kaanooo izam munzareen

9.t: We Ourselves have revealed the Quran and We are its Protectors.
9.tr: Innaa Nahnu nazalnaz Zikra Wa-Innaa lahoo lahaa-fizoon

10.t: We sent Messengers to the ancient people who lived before you.
10.tr: Wa-laqad arsalnaa min qablika fee shiya'il awwaleen

11.t: No Messenger went to them whom they did not mock.
11.tr: Wa-maa yaateehim mir Rasoolin illaa kaanoo bihee yastahzi'oon

12.t: This is how We cause the hearts of the guilty ones to behave.

13.t: They do not believe in the Truth and they exactly follow the tradition of the ancient (unbelievers)
13.tr: Laa yu'minoona bihee Wa-qad khalat sunnatul awwaleen

14.t: Had We opened a door for them in the sky through which they could easily pass,
14.tr: Wa-law fatahnaa 'alaihim baabam minas samaaa'i fazaloo feehi ya'rujoon

15.t: they would have said, "Our eyes are bewildered and we have been affected by magic."
15.tr: Laqaaloo innamaa sukkirat absaarunaa bal nahnu qawmum mashooroon

16.t: We have made constellations in the sky and decorated them for the onlookers.
16.tr: Wa-laqad ja'alnaa fis samaaa'i buroojanw Wa-zaiyannaahaa linnaazireen

17.t: We have protected them from every condemned devil,

18.t: except for those who stealthily try to listen to the heavens, but who are chased away by a bright flame.
18.tr: Illaa manis taraqas sam'a fa-atba'ahoo shihaabum mubeen

19.t: We have spread out the earth, fixed mountains thereupon and caused everything to grow to its proper weight
19.tr: Wal-arda madadnaahaa Wa-alqainaa feehaa rawaasiya Wa-ambatnaa feehaa min kulli shai'im mawzoon

20.t: to provide you and those for whose sustenance you are not responsible, with the necessities of life.
20.tr: Wa-ja'alnaa lakum feehaa ma'aayisha Wa-mal lastum lahoo biraaziqeen

21.t: With Us is the source of everything and We do not send it down except in a known quantity.
21.tr: Wa-im min shai'in illaa 'indanaa khazaaa-'inuhoo Wa-maa nunazziluhooo illaa biqadarim ma'loom

22.t: We send impregnating winds and send down water from the sky for you to drink and you have no (control over its) storage.
22.tr: Wa-arsalnar riyaaha la-waaqiha fa-anzalnaa minas samaaa'i maaa'an fa-asqai-naakumoohu Wa-maaa antum lahoo bikhaazineen

23.t: It is We who give life and cause things to die and We are the sole Heirs.
23.tr: Wa-innnaa la-nahnu nuhyee Wa-numeetu Wa-nahnul waarisoon

24.t: We know the people who lived before you and those who will come into existence after you.

25.t: Your Lord will resurrect them all; He is All-wise and All-knowing.
25.tr: Wa-inna Rabbaka Huwa yahshuruhum; innahoo Hakeemun 'Aleem

26.t: We have created the human being out of pure mud-moulded clay
26.tr: Wa-laqad khalaqnal insaana min salsaalim min hama-im masnoon

27.t: and the jinn before (the human being) of smokeless fire.
27.tr: Waljaaanna khalaqnaahu min qablu min naaris samoom

28.t: When your Lord said to the angels, "I will create the human being out of pure mud-moulded clay.
28.tr: Wa-iz qaala Rabbuka lilmalaaa'-ikati innee khaaliqum basharam min salsaalim min hama-im masnoon

29.t: When it is properly shaped and I have blown My Spirit into it, you should then bow down in prostration".
29.tr: Fa-izaa sawwaituhoo Wa-nafakhtu feehi mir roohee faqa'oo lahoo saajideen

30.t: All the angels prostrated before Adam

31.t: except Iblis who refused to join with the others in prostration.
31.tr: Illaaa ibleesa abaaa ai yakoona ma'as saajideen

32.t: God asked Iblis, "What made you not join the others in prostration?"
32.tr: Qaala yaaa-Ibleesu maa laka allaa takoona ma'as saajideen

33.t: Iblis replied, "I did not want to prostrate before a human being whom You have created out of mud-moulded clay".
33.tr: Qaala lam akul li-asjuda libasharin khalaqtahoo min salsaalim min hama-im masnoon

34.t: God told him, "Get out of the garden; you are rejected

35.t: and will be subjected to condemnation until the Day of Judgment."

36.t: Iblis prayed, "Lord, grant me respite until the Day of Judgment".
36.tr: Qaala Rabbi fa-anzirneee ilaa Yawmi yub'asoon

37.t: The Lord said, "Your request is granted

39.t: Iblis said, "Lord, because you have caused me to go astray, I shall make earthly things attractive to (people) and mislead all of them
39.tr: Qaala Rabbi bimaaa aghwaitanee la-uzayyin-anna lahum fil ardi Wa-la-ughwiyan-nahum ajma'een

41.t: God said, "The path which leads to Me is a straight

42.t: and you have no authority over My servants except the erring ones who follow you.
42.tr: Inna 'ibaadee laisa laka 'alaihim sultaanun illaa manit taba'aka minal ghaaween

43.t: Hell is the promised place for them all.

44.t: It has seven gates and each gate is assigned for a certain group of people.
44.tr: Lahaa sab'atu abwaab; likulli baabim minhum juz'um maqsoom

45.t: The pious will live in gardens with streams

46.t: and they will be told to enter there in peace and safety.

47.t: We shall remove all hatred from their breasts and make them as brothers reclining on thrones facing one another.
47.tr: Wa-naza'naa ma fee sudoorihim min ghillin ikhwaanan 'alaa sururim mutaqaabileen

48.t: No fatigue will touch them nor will they be expelled therefrom."
48.tr: Laa yamas-suhum feehaa nasabunw Wa-maa hum minhaa bimukhrajeen

49.t: (Muhammad), tell My servants that I am All-forgiving and All-merciful

50.t: and that My punishment is a painful one.

51.t: Tell them about the guests of Abraham

52.t: who came to him saying, "Peace be with you." Abraham said, "We are afraid of you".
52.tr: Iz dakhaloo 'alaihi faqaaloo salaaman qaala innaa minkum wajiloon

53.t: They replied, "Do not be afraid. We have brought you the glad news of (the birth) of a learned son".
53.tr: Qaaloo la tawjal innaa nubashshiruka bighulaamin 'aleem

54.t: Abraham asked, "Are you giving me the glad news of a son in my old age? What reason can you give for such glad news?"
54.tr: Qaala abashshartumoonee 'alaaa am massaniyal kibaru fabima tubashshiroon

55.t: They said, "We have given you the glad news for a true reason so do not despair".
55.tr: Qaaloo bashsharnaaka bilhaqqi falaa takum minal qaaniteen

56.t: He said, "No one despairs of the mercy of his Lord except those who are in error.
56.tr: Qaala Wa-mai yaqnatu mir rahmati Rabbiheee illad daaaloon

58.t: They said, "We are sent to a sinful people.
58.tr: Qaaloo innaaa ursilnaaa ilaa qawmim mujrimeen

59.t: Only the family of Lot will all be saved,
59.tr: Illaaa Aala Loot; innaa lamunajjoohum ajma'een

60.t: except his wife who is doomed to be left behind."
60.tr: Illam ra-atahoo qaddarnaaa innahaa laminal ghaabireen

61.t: When the Messengers came to the family of Lot,

62.t: he said, "You seem to be strangers".

63.t: They replied, "We have come to you about the matter which the (unbelievers) have rejected.
63.tr: Qaaloo bal ji'naaka bimaa kaanoo feehi yamtaroon

64.t: We have come to you for a genuine purpose and We are true in what we say.

65.t: Leave the town with your family sometime during the night. Walk behind them and let no one turn around. Proceed as you are commanded."
65.tr: Fa-asri bi-ahlika biqit'im minal laili wattabi' adbaarahum Wa-laa yaltafit minkum ahadunw wamdoo haisu tu'maroon

66.t: We informed him that the unbelievers would be utterly destroyed.
66.tr: Wa-qadainaaa ilaihi zaalikal amra anna daabira haaa'ulaaa'i maqtoo'um musbiheen

67.t: The people of the town rejoicingly

68.t: rushed towards the house of Lot. Lot said to them, "These are my guests. Do not disgrace me.
68.tr: Qaala inna haaa'ulaaa'i daifee falaa tafdahoon

69.t: Have fear of God and do not humiliate me".

70.t: They replied, "Did we not forbid you to bring anyone to your house?"

71.t: Lot said, "These are my daughters if you want them."
71.tr: Qaala haaa'ulaaa'i banaateee in kuntum faa'ileen

72.t: By your life! In their drunkenness they were truly blind.

73.t: An explosion struck them at sunrise.

74.t: We turned the town upside-down and showered on them lumps of baked clay.
74.tr: Faja'alnaa 'aaliyahaa saafilahaa Wa-amtamaa 'alaihim hijaaratam min sijjeel

75.t: In this there is evidence (of the Truth) for the prudent ones.

76.t: That town lies on a road which still exists.

77.t: In this there is evidence (of the Truth) for the believers.

78.t: Since the People of the Forest were unjust,

79.t: We afflicted them with punishment. Both people had clear (divine) authority among them.

80.t: People of Hijr rejected the Messengers.

81.t: We showed them miracles but they ignored them.

82.t: They would carve secure houses out of the mountains.
82.tr: Wa-kaanoo yanhitoona minal jibaali buyootan aamineen

83.t: An explosion struck them in the morning.

84.t: Out of what they had gained, nothing proved to be of any benefit to them.

85.t: We have created the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, for a genuine purpose. The Day of Judgment will certainly approach, so (Muhammad) forgive them graciously.
85.tr: Wa-maa khalaqnas samaawaati wal-arda Wa-maa bainahumaaa illaa bilhaqq; Wa-innas Saa'ata la-aatiyatun fasfahis safhal jameel

86.t: Your Lord is certainly the All-knowing Creator.

87.t: (Muhammad), We have given you the seven most repeated (verses) and the great Quran.
87.tr: Wa-laqad aatainaaka sab'am minal masaanee wal-Qur-aanal 'Azeem

88.t: Do not yearn for other people's property and wives and do not grieve (that they do not believe). Be kind to the believers.
88.tr: Laa tamuddanna 'ainaika ilaa maa matta-'naa biheee azwaajam minhum Wa-laa tahzan 'alaihim wakhfid janaahaka lilmu-'mineen

89.t: Say, "Indeed, I am simply one who warns."

90.t: (We have given you the Quran) as We had given (the Bible) to those who divided themselves into groups

91.t: and also divided the Quran believing in some parts and rejecting others.

92.t: By the Lord, We will hold them all responsible

94.t: Preach what you have been commanded to and stay away from the pagans.
94.tr: Fasda' bimaa tu'maru Wa-a'rid anil mushrikeen

95.t: We shall help you against those who mock you

96.t: and believe other things to be equal to God. They will soon know the truth.
96.tr: Allazeena yaj'aloona ma'al laahi ilaahan aakhar; fasawfa ya'lamoon

97.t: We certainly know that you feel sad about what they say against you.
97.tr: Wa-laqad na'lamu annaka yadeequ sadruka bimaa yaqooloon

98.t: Glorify and praise your Lord and be with those who prostrate themselves before God.
98.tr: Fasbbih bihamdi Rabbika Wa-kum minas saajideen

99.t: Worship your Lord until you achieve the ultimate certainty.
